DataElement.preferredName: Patient Follow-up Clinical Institutional Review Board Approval Consent Withdrawn Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to the acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body (internal review board) of the patient's withdrawal (when the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn) of consent to participate in clinical study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Follow-up Clinical Institutional Review Board Approval Consent Withdrawn
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body (internal review board) of the patient's withdrawal (when the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn) of consent to participate in clinical study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Follow-up Clinical Institutional Review Board Approval Consent Withdrawn
Property.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:An oversite group responsible for approving clinical trials protocols and monitoring adherence to established protocols.:Approved; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.
When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
